intro: Perezia montana var. typica, commonly known as the mountain perezia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. Perezia montana var. typica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
